subject: Add the System::Log label for /var/log
commitMessage:
Add the System::Log label for /var/log

Create the System domain label System::Log.
This is the label for /var/log.
Log files with System and User labels will get written to /var/log.
The accesses are not transmutting.

Change-Id: Iaa3aa8d3883c7c6bf1734e3e9224eaf6f701e86a
Signed-off-by: Casey Schaufler <casey.schaufler@intel.com>

subject: This adds new rules for locking for System to _ and User to _
commitMessage:
This adds new rules for locking for System to _ and
User to _

Change-Id: Id483970ad6606543fb3856f7d4bdd738e0cf1a9d
Signed-off-by: Michael Demeter <michael.demeter@intel.com>

comments.message: Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Patch Set 1:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project Tizen:IVI: 

 repository     arch           result         

 standard       i586           succeeded

Patch Set 1:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project devel:ivi: 

 repository     arch           result         

 standard       i586           succeeded

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Looks right.

Patch Set 1:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project Tizen:Mobile: 

 repository     arch           result         

 qemu           x86_64         succeeded      

 qemu           armv7l         failed         

 qemu           i586           succeeded

Patch Set 1: Verified-1

The package install fails, since the security plugin doesn't support the 'l' character yet:

error: Not allowed character in access type: l
error: Failed to parse manifest for default-ac-domains
error: default-ac-domains-0.1-1.noarch: install failed

Patch Set 1:

I just merged and submitted the rpm change to allow l

Patch Set 1:

The security plugin patch fixes the errors on install, but the /etc/smack/accesses.d/default-ac-domains file is not formatted correctly... It needs an extra access field for each rule to accomodate 'l'.

Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Since the package installs without error, I think it's okay to accept this change.

There is still a bug in the format of the rules file, but that requires a separate fix.
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.
